question.text: Select the correct option with respect to thermal pollution.

options.text: Speeds up biodegradation of organic matter
Leads to the death of temperature-sensitive organisms
Increases the rate of metabolism and microbial activity
Enhances the growth of aquatic life without harming the indigenous species

solution.text: Thermal pollution damages the natural environment, due to which the metabolism of the organism decreases and ultimately causes death. Optimum temperature increases the metabolic rate but high temperature disrupts the enzymatic activity. Also decreases the oxygen content of water. It may enhance the growth of plants and fish in extremely cold areas but, only after causing damage to the indigenous flora and fauna.
